API¶

This page contains a comprehensive list of all functions within gamla. Docstrings should provide sufficient understanding for any individual function.

data¶

match(dataclass_pattern)

creates a function that returns true if input matches dataclass_pattern.

functional¶

translate_exception(func, exc1, exc2)

func is assumed to be unary.

make_call_key(args, kwargs)

Stable id for function calls, can be used for caching.

top(iterable[, key])

Generates elements from max to min.

bottom(iterable[, key])

Generates elements from min to max.

groupby_many_reduce(key, reducer, seq)

Group a collection by a key function, when the value is given by a reducer function.

unique_by(f)

Return only unique elements of a sequence defined by function f

functional_async¶

run_sync(f)

Runs a coroutine in a synchronous context, blocking until result arrives.

functional_generic¶

lazyjuxt(*funcs)

Reverts to eager implementation if any of funcs is async.

apply_spec(spec)

 

>>> spec = {"len": len, "sum": sum}

bifurcate(*funcs)

Serially runs each function on tee’d copies of input_generator.

countby_many(f)

Count elements of a collection by a function which returns a tuple of keys for single element.

graph¶

graph_traverse_many(sources, get_neighbors)

BFS over a graph, yielding unique nodes.

general_graph_traverse_many(sources, …)

BFS over a graph, yielding unique nodes.

traverse_graph_by_radius(source, …)

Like graph_traverse, but does not traverse farther from given radius.

get_connectivity_components(graph)

Graph is assumed to undirected, so each edge must appear both ways.

Definitions¶

class gamla.data.Enum¶
class gamla.data.frozendict(*args, **kwargs)¶
gamla.data.match(dataclass_pattern)¶

creates a function that returns true if input matches dataclass_pattern. Use data.Any as wildcard for field value. Supports recursive patterns.

gamla.functional.bottom(iterable, key=<function identity>)¶

Generates elements from min to max.

gamla.functional.groupby_many_reduce(key: Callable, reducer: Callable, seq: Iterable)¶

Group a collection by a key function, when the value is given by a reducer function.

Parameters: key (Callable): Key function (given object in collection outputs key). reducer (Callable): Reducer function (given object in collection outputs new value). seq (Iterable): Collection.

Returns: Dict[Text, Any]: Dictionary where key has been computed by the key function and value by the reducer function.

gamla.functional.make_call_key(args, kwargs)¶

Stable id for function calls, can be used for caching.

gamla.functional.top(iterable, key=<function identity>)¶

Generates elements from max to min.

gamla.functional.translate_exception(func, exc1, exc2)¶

func is assumed to be unary.

gamla.functional.unique_by(f)¶

Return only unique elements of a sequence defined by function f

>>> tuple(unique_by(['cat', 'mouse', 'dog', 'hen'], f=len))
('cat', 'mouse')
gamla.functional_async.run_sync(f)¶

Runs a coroutine in a synchronous context, blocking until result arrives.

exception gamla.functional_generic.NoConditionMatched¶
gamla.functional_generic.alljuxt(*funcs)¶

Reverts to eager implementation if any of funcs is async.

gamla.functional_generic.anyjuxt(*funcs)¶

Reverts to eager implementation if any of funcs is async.

gamla.functional_generic.apply_spec(spec)¶
>>> spec = {"len": len, "sum": sum}
>>> apply_spec(spec)([1,2,3,4,5])
{'len': 5, 'sum': 15}

Notes: - The dictionary can be nested. - Returned function will be async iff any leaf is an async function.

gamla.functional_generic.bifurcate(*funcs)¶

Serially runs each function on tee’d copies of input_generator.

gamla.functional_generic.case_dict()¶

D.items() -> a set-like object providing a view on D’s items

gamla.functional_generic.concat(iterable, /)¶

Alternative chain() constructor taking a single iterable argument that evaluates lazily.

gamla.functional_generic.countby_many(f)¶

Count elements of a collection by a function which returns a tuple of keys for single element.

Parameters: f (Callable): Key function (given object in collection outputs tuple of keys). it (Iterable): Collection.

Returns: Dict[Text, Any]: Dictionary where key has been computed by the f key function and value is the frequency of this key.

>>> names = ['alice', 'bob', 'charlie', 'dan', 'edith', 'frank']
>>> countby_many(lambda name: (name[0], name[-1]), names)
{'a': 1,
 'e': 3,
 'b': 2,
 'c': 1,
 'd': 1,
 'n': 1,
 'h': 1,
 'f': 1,
 'k': 1}
gamla.functional_generic.juxt(*funcs)¶

Reverts to eager implementation if any of funcs is async.

gamla.functional_generic.juxtcat(*funcs)¶

Reverts to eager implementation if any of funcs is async.

gamla.functional_generic.lazyjuxt(*funcs)¶

Reverts to eager implementation if any of funcs is async.

gamla.graph.general_graph_traverse_many(sources: Any, get_neighbors: Callable, remember: Callable, should_traverse: Callable) → Iterable¶

BFS over a graph, yielding unique nodes. Note: get_neighbors must return elements without duplicates.

gamla.graph.get_connectivity_components(graph: Dict) → Iterable[FrozenSet]¶

Graph is assumed to undirected, so each edge must appear both ways.

gamla.graph.graph_traverse_many(sources: Any, get_neighbors: Callable, key: Callable = <function identity>) → Iterable¶

BFS over a graph, yielding unique nodes. Note: get_neighbors must return elements without duplicates.

gamla.graph.groupby_many(f, it)¶

Return a mapping `{y: {x s.t. y in f(x)}}, where x in it. `

Parameters: f (Callable): Key function (given object in collection outputs tuple of keys). it (Iterable): Collection.

Returns: Dict[Text, Any]: Dictionary where key has been computed by the f key function.

>>> names = ['alice', 'bob', 'charlie', 'dan', 'edith', 'frank']
>>> groupby_many(lambda name: (name[0], name[-1]), names)
{'a': frozenset({'alice'}),
 'e': frozenset({'alice', 'charlie', 'edith'}),
 'b': frozenset({'bob'}),
 'c': frozenset({'charlie'}),
 'd': frozenset({'dan'}),
 'n': frozenset({'dan'}),
 'h': frozenset({'edith'}),
 'f': frozenset({'frank'}),
 'k': frozenset({'frank'})}
gamla.graph.traverse_graph_by_radius(source: Any, get_neighbors: Callable, radius: int) → Iterable¶

Like graph_traverse, but does not traverse farther from given radius.

gamla
